entry.title: BIC-MNI/bic-pipelines
entry.summary:
Brain Imaging Center Image Processing Pipelines

Brain Imaging Center Image Processing Pipelines

Introduction

This project includes basic image processing pipelines intended to be run on raw output from the scanner (in Minc format) and produce output suitable for population analysis in standard stereotaxic space.

Installation

All pipelines are written in high-level scripting language (Perl,Python or Ruby) and require complete installation of minc-toolkit ( https://github.com/BIC-MNI/minc-toolkit )

installation consist of copying all scripts into the same directory, and setting PATH and PERL5LIB to include this directiry

MNI_DATADIR should point to the location of icbm152_model_09c ( or specify location of the models in the command line)

Usage

Pipeline processes a dataset with one T1w scan and (optionally) one T2w and PDw scans acquired using dual echo sequnce (i.e t2w and pdw scans are expected to be co-registered)

to start:

standard_pipeline.pl

[path to T2w scan]
[path to T2w scan]
[ --prefix ] [ --model_dir ] [ --model <name of the anatomical model (default mni_icbm152_t1_tal_nlin_sym_09c) ]

Will create subdirectory structure in :

specifies subject ID ( any sequence of characters, without spaces), - visit label (for example V1 V2 etc.) - file name of T1 scan [T2 file] - optional T2 scan [PD file] - optional PD scan - base directory where all results will be placed. The pipeline script will create subdirectory / / / .... and will put all files there:

./clp - intensity normalization (map all values to the 0-100 range approxiately) ./clp/clamp_ t1w.mnc t1w scan ./clp/clamp t2w.mnc t2w scan (if present) ./clp/clamp _ _pdw.mnc pdw scan (if present)

./tal - registration in stereotaxic space ./tal/tal_xfm_ t1w.xfm - registration parameters for t1w ./tal/tal_xfm t2w.xfm - registration parameters for t2w/pdw (if present) ./tal/tal t1w.mnc - t1w scan in the stereotaxic space ./tal/tal t2w.mnc - t2w scan in the stereotaxic space ./tal/tal pdw.mnc - pdw scan in the stereotaxic space ./tal/tal_noscale_xfm t1w.xfm - registration parameters fot t1w without scaling ./tal/tal_noscale_xfm t2w.xfm - registration parameters fot t2w without scaling ./tal/tal_noscale_xfm pdw.xfm - registration parameters fot pdw without scaling ./tal/tal_noscale t1w.mnc - t1w scan in stereotaxic space, unscaled ./tal/tal_noscale t2w.mnc - t1w scan in stereotaxic space, unscaled ./tal/tal_noscale pdw.mnc - t1w scan in stereotaxic space, unscaled ./tal/tal_comp_msk .mnc - brain mask

./nl - nonlinear registration into sterotaxic space ./nl/nl_xfm_ .xfm - registration parameters ./nl/nl_xfm grid_0.mnc ./nl/nl t1w.mnc - scan nonlinearly registered into stereotaxic space ./nl/nl_jacobian _ .mnc - jacobian determinant map of the nonlinear part of transformation

./tal_cls - tissue classification using linear registration into sterotaxic space ./tal_cls/tal_clean_ _ .mnc - tissue map

./lob - brain segmentation ./lob/tal_clean_lob_ .mnc - brain segmentation using linear registration ./lob/nl_clean_lob _ .mnc - brain segmentation using nonlinear registration (more precise)

./qc - Quality Control Images ./qc/qc_face_ .jpg - face rendering ./qc/qc_t1w .jpg - head with stx target outline (linear registration) ./qc/qc_tal_t1t2 .jpg - t2w and t1w co-registration ./qc/qc_nl_reg .jpg - brain with stx target outline (nonlinear registration) ./qc/qc_t1w_lc_clean .jpg - tissue classification (linear) ./qc/qc_nl_t1w_segment_lobe _ .jpg - brain segmentation (nonlinear)

./vol ./vol/nl_ _ .txt - text file with volumes of various substructures (in native space)
